reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A suprise break for my wife - with visits to the Eden Project and the Lost Gardens of Heligan. We had booked dinner, bed and breakfast for three nights and had been given an upgraded de-luxe room with fantastic views over Carlyon Bay.
reviews.title: Perfect place for a leisure break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose to have dinner in the restaurant rather than in the bistro. The waitresses, Laura and Claire, were extremely pleasant and chatty - a delight compared to the surliness of some waitresses we have encountered. The owner, George,and the chef, John both found time to talk to us and were extremely helpful with travel advice and cooking techniques respectively. The food was of good quality and well prepared. It was not pub food and was priced accordingly.
reviews.title: The friendliest hotel we have experienced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all - a very pleasant stay. We will be back!
reviews.title: Location and View make it worthwhile
Reasonable but there must be better
reviews.text: We have just returned from a thoroughly enjoyable stay at the Porth Avallen Hotel despite atrocious weather. The staff were outstanding and their friendliness and warmth of welcome was really appreciated. The food was of a very good standard and the chef took the time to ask us after each meal if everything had been ok and joined us as we were ordering to discuss the items on the menu and advise us as to the ingredients and cooking style. Through no fault of the staff or the hotel we found ourselves sleeping next door to someone who should challenge the Guiness books of records for snoring, we were moved to a better room without fuss and with great courtesy. We will return and have already recommended the hotel to friends and family. Thank you Porth Avallen.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We weren't quite sure what to expect since this was our first trip to the area. As we turned off the main road, we realized we were in a very upscale neighborhood of beautiful homes overlooking the bay -- very impressive. We found the Porth Avallen easily and although the outside looks just "average" (meaning not very deluxe and a bit old fashioned, if not "worn"), we were optimistic because of the neighborhood. We were greeted warmly by reception and ended up getting a lot of good information about the area, especially advice about a walking path that leads down to Charlestown, a cute little fishing village with a few places to eat lunch. Our room was not ready, so we set off for Charlestown (a delightful side trip) and by the time we returned, our room was ready as promised.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, fab food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at this hotel as part of a wedding party and it is out of respect for my friends that it has taken a month or two to write the review.
reviews.title: Fawlty Towers

reviews.text: the setting is brilliant - the view goes on for miles and the location and availability of free parking is superb.
reviews.title: Lovely staff and evening food, bedroom rather shabby.

reviews.text: The hotel itself is like a maze - it was easier for us to go back out the front door and in through the back door to get to our room such is the maze of stairs and corridors that we had to negotiate....trail of breadcrumbs springs to mind.
reviews.title: great stay...just would have liked more choice at breakfast!

reviews.text: Rooms themselves were compact and we could hear next door when they opened the wardrobe/spoke on the phone etc. Hot water and tea and coffee available.
reviews.title: Poor value

reviews.text: Service was unbelievable.Although many of the staff are very good, the Manager/Owner made this the worst hotel about - at one stage he told us to be quiet as other guests were paying 'considerably more than we were for the room'. Despite licence, on the day of the wedding the Bar closed at the whim of the manager at 11.15pm not 1am as previously agreed with the Bride and Groom. Food was good although the tray charge is the same price as the food itself.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had was very good - large double bed, good sized room, marvellous views over the bay! The bathroom was a good size but the water flow from the shower was poor.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, marvellous views.

reviews.text: All staff were very friendly & helpful.
reviews.title: Overpriced and disappointing

reviews.text: Food in the restaurant and bistro was well prepared & of high quality.
reviews.title: Not a hotel for children, and offers over priced functions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are visiting the Eden Project, this hotel is in a good location because there is a route to it avoiding main roads - directions supplied by the hotel.
reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect!!

reviews.text: We had our wedding here in April. We chose it due to the fantastic location, the beautiful refurbished gardens and function room. Overall, we had a wonderful day but there were some things that were disappointing and that other potential customers would benefit from being aware of. Without any prior warning the new garden that we were looking forward to having our photographs taken in and our guests being able to enjoy, was cordoned off on the day. When we questioned this afterwards we were told that it was "unsafe" for children and as there were four children at the wedding it was deemed appropriate to make it inaccessible.
reviews.title: Travelodge Room at Country Hotel Prices
